title: Telmate Tablets Propel Local Delaware, IN Jail to Forefront of Inmate Technology
text:
The Delaware County Sheriff’s Office, Jail Division, today announced the installation of Telmate Tablets, a cutting-edge inmate technology provided by Telmate, a leader in the world of corrections technology, based in San Francisco, CA. Telmate currently provides the jail’s inmate phone system.
Delaware County, IN (PRWEB) October 05, 2015
The Delaware County Sheriff’s Office, Jail Division, today announced the installation of Telmate Tablets, a cutting-edge inmate technology provided by Telmate, a leader in the world of corrections technology, based in San Francisco, CA. Telmate currently provides the jail’s inmate phone system.
Telmate Tablets are wireless access points to Telmate’s suite of inmate software services that include messaging, photo sharing, approved entertainment, paperless requests and grievances, ebooks, commissary ordering, account management and more. Utilizing this innovative technology inmates have new ways to connect with friends and family, access content, occupy their time and manage their account. At the same time, the facility gains operational efficiencies and economical advantages through the systems’ automation of facility processes like inmate grievances and requests, as well as through the systems’ Telmate Investigator Tools, which turn data into actionable, crime-solving intelligence.
The ultra-secure Telmate Tablet solution features corrections-grade, locked-down devices, hotspots, and security servers and the device requires inmates to have a unique PIN for access.
Located in Muncie, Indiana, the Delaware County Sheriff’s Office is dedicated to serving the law enforcement needs of the county and surrounding communities. According to Jail Commander Rick Richman, “The addition of the new technology will push the jail to the forefront of corrections with the most advanced jail technology and communications available.”
“We are very excited about bringing Telmate’s innovative technology to our jail,” Richman added. “Not only are we investing in cutting-edge technology for inmates to connect with loved ones, we are also introducing an effective behavior modification tool.”
Facility staff have 24/7/365 web access and control of the Telmate Tablets and software services through a web-based admin interface called Telmate Command. Jail staff can log into the Telmate system using any web-enabled device including personal computers, tablets and smartphones.
The Telmate Tablets and suite of software services are currently deployed in over 35 facilities nationwide, generating over 3 million minutes of monthly usage. For more information about the Telmate Tablet, please visit http://www.telmate.com/tablet .
###
About Delaware County Sheriff’s Office:
Delaware County Sheriff’s Office is dedicated to serving the law enforcement needs of the community in which we work and live. Through continual training and a proactive approach to community policing, we will strive to maintain and improve the quality of life for all citizens of Delaware County.
About Telmate:
Telmate is the fastest growing provider of inmate phones and video visitation, secure messaging, mobile applications, inmate tablets and investigator tools. Telmate’s cutting-edge platforms are deployed in over 300 facilities nationwide and four Canadian provinces. Telmate is headquartered in San Francisco, California. To find out more about Telmate, visit http://www.telmate.com .
